channel.title: DSLinter - Linter for Machine Learning - Specific Code Smells
channel.description: Recent content on DSLinter - Linter for Machine Learning - Specific Code Smells

item.title: In-Place APIs Misused
item.description: Remember to assign the result of an operation to a variable or set the in-place parameter in the API.

item.title: Unnecessary Iteration
item.description: Avoid unnecessary iterations. Use vectorized solutions instead of loops.

item.title: No Scaling Before Scaling-sensitive Operation
item.description: Check whether feature scaling is added before scaling-sensitive operations.

item.title: Hyperparameter not Explicitly Set
item.description: Hyperparameters should be set explicitly.

item.title: Memory not Freed
item.description: Free memory in time.

item.title: Deterministic Algorithm Option Not Used
item.description: Set deterministic algorithm option to True during the development process, and use the option that provides better performance in the production.

item.title: Missing the Mask of Invalid Value
item.description: Add a mask for possible invalid values. For example, developers should add a mask for the input for tf.log() API.

item.title: Randomness Uncontrolled
item.description: Set random seed explicitly during the development process whenever a possible random procedure is involved in the application.

item.title: Data Leakage
item.description: Use Pipeline() API in Scikit-Learn or check data segregation carefully when using other libraries to prevent data leakage.

item.title: Threshold-Dependent Validation
item.description: Use threshold-independent metrics instead of threshold-dependent ones in model evaluation.

item.title: NaN Equivalence Comparison Misused
item.description: Be careful when using the NaN equivalence comparison in NumPy and Pandas.

item.title: Chain Indexing
item.description: Avoid using chain indexing in Pandas.

item.title: Dataframe Coversion API Misused
item.description: Use df.to_numpy() in Pandas instead of df.values() for transform a DataFrame to a NumPy array.

item.title: Matrix Multiplication API Misused
item.description: When the multiply operation is performed on two-dimensional matrixes, use np.matmul() instead of np.dot() in NumPy for better semantics.

item.title: Columns and DataType Not Explicitly Set
item.description: Explicitly select columns and set DataType in Pandas.

item.title: Empty Column Misinitialization
item.description: When a new empty column is needed in a DataFrame in Pandas, use the NaN value in Numpy instead of using zeros or empty strings.

item.title: Merge API Parameter Not Explicitly Set
item.description: Explicitly specify on, how and validate parameter for df.merge() API in Pandas for better readability.

item.title: Broadcasting Feature Not Used
item.description: Use the broadcasting feature in TensorFlow 2 to be more memory efficient.

item.title: TensorArray Not Used
item.description: Use tf.TensorArray() in TensorFlow 2 if the value of the array will change in the loop.

item.title: Pytorch Call Method Misused
item.description: Use self.net() in PyTorch to forward the input to the network instead of self.net.forward().

item.title: Training / Evaluation Mode Improper Toggling
item.description: Call the training mode in the appropriate place in PyTorch code to avoid forgetting to toggle back the training mode after the inference step.

item.title: Gradients Not Cleared before Backward Propagation
item.description: Use optimizer.zero_grad(), loss_fn.backward(), optimizer.step() together in order in PyTorch. Do not forget to use optimizer.zero_grad() before loss_fn.backward() to clear gradients.
